- [ ] Type checking passes (mypy strict mode) â€” no errors

### Testing

- [ ] Tests are added/updated for behavior changes
- [ ] Coverage requirements met (core â‰¥95%, other â‰¥85%)
- [ ] Test names are descriptive (explain what is tested)
- [ ] Error cases are tested (not just happy path)

### Architecture & Design

- [ ] Code respects Luminote's layered architecture (core, services, api,
  schemas)
- [ ] Related ADRs reviewed and followed
- [ ] Two-pane reading principle maintained (for frontend changes)
- [ ] BYOK and user-triggered AI principles respected (for backend/AI changes)

### Documentation

- [ ] Comments added for non-obvious logic
- [ ] API endpoints documented (if added)
- [ ] Configuration changes documented (if any)
- [ ] README updated (if changing setup or behavior)

### PR Hygiene

- [ ] Related issues linked (Closes #, Depends on #)
- [ ] No unrelated formatting changes
- [ ] Commit messages follow conventional commits
- [ ] Changes are focused (minimal blast radius)

## Review Instructions for Humans

**Priority checks:**

1. Does the PR solve the original issue completely?

1. Does the code follow the patterns shown in existing code?
1. Are there any security or performance concerns?
